Plot a legend for a visual predictive check (VPC)

Source: R/plot_vpc_legend.R
plot_vpc_legend.Rd

Plot a legend for a visual predictive check (VPC)

Usage

plot_vpc_legend(ci = c(0.05, 0.95), pi = c(0.05, 0.95))

Arguments

ci

simulated confidence interval plotted. Should match argument passed to vpc::vpc(). Default is c(0.05, 0.95).

pi

prediction intervals for plotted. Should match argument passed to vpc::vpc(). Default is c(0.05, 0.95),

Value

a ggplot2 object

Examples

plot_vpc_legend()
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_point()`).
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_line()`).
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_line()`).
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_rect()`).
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_rect()`).

plot_vpc_legend(pi = c(0.05, 0.95), ci = c(0.025, 0.975))
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
#> (`geom_point()`).
#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range

#> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
